programme.title: Joe Dante Enters the Atomic Age
programme.desc: TFH creator Joe Dante highlights Hollywood's atomic age paranoia and the nightmares unleashed on unsuspecting audiences.

programme.title: Kaiju Classics
programme.desc: Giant monsters are on the rampage! Who will save us?

programme.title: Gamera: Destroy all Planets
programme.desc: Alien conquerors plot to destroy humanity using mind control and the monster Viras. Can Gamera stop this madness??

programme.title: Atomic Age Sci-fi Classics Vol. 1
programme.desc: Journey back to the 1950s and 60s, where science and imagination brought forth a new wave of classic films.

programme.title: Atomic Age Sci-fi Classics Vol. 2
programme.desc: Monsters, aliens, mutants, and more! Who will save us from cinema's most terrifying atomic-era creatures?

programme.title: The Last Woman On Earth
programme.desc: Roger Corman directed this 1960 sci-fi thriller that follows three people who surface from a scuba expedition to find the entire population has been mysteriously wiped out. Now, the last two surviving men will fight for the Last Woman On Earth!

programme.title: Atomic Age Sci-fi Classics Vol. 3
programme.desc: It's a wild blast from the past, as atomic monsters, aliens, and more invade your living room!

programme.title: Atomic Age Sci-fi Classics Vol. 4
programme.desc: From the depths of space (and deeper), comes an all-new collection of intergalactic invaders and futuristic fears!

programme.title: Teenagers from Outer Space
programme.desc: As if America didn’t have enough trouble with its own teens, a group of young aliens arrive in a flying saucer, commit animal cruelty, and plot to make the planet a breeding ground for gargantuan lobster-like monsters.

programme.title: Impostor Syndrome: The Best of Big Screen Body Snatchers
programme.desc: In these sci-fi classics, no one is quite who they seem, and the threat of invasion is closer than you think.

programme.title: Retro Futures: 80s Sci-Fi Classics
programme.desc: Science fiction dominated cinema screens in the 1980s, and these are the ones we'll always remember.

programme.title: When Spielberg Hit Hollywood
programme.desc: These are the early hits that made Steven Spielberg the biggest name in blockbuster movies.

programme.title: Terror Titans: The Films of Wes Craven and John Carpenter
programme.desc: Two masters of horror bring your nightmares to the big screen in this spine-chilling collection.

programme.title: Hitchcock: The Master of Suspense
programme.desc: TFH celebrates Alfred Hitchcock and the masterful storytelling that still keeps audiences on the edge of their seats.

programme.title: Trailers From Hell
programme.desc: While “The Raven” may fly high, others less fortunate are subject to a “Premature Burial” inside “The Tomb of Ligeia”

programme.title: Trailers From Hell
programme.desc: No kids, we are not in Narnia. Let’s go to the “Little Shop of Horrors” and have a drink with “The Wild Angels.”

programme.title: Trailers From Hell
programme.desc: When “Boxcar Bertha” and “Bloody Mama” took a trip to “Hollywood Boulevard,” they told some car thieves to “Eat My Dust,” and drove off like they were extras in “Death Race 2000.”

programme.title: Scorsese, Leone, and Larry Cohen
programme.desc: Three directors. Three unique styles. Three incredible legacies.

programme.title: Friedkin, De Palma, and Carpenter
programme.desc: Take a closer look at the classic films of William Friedkin, Brian De Palma, and John Carpenter.

programme.title: You Don't Know Jack Hill
programme.desc: A legend in the exploitation genre, these are the films that define director Jack Hill's career.

programme.title: Joe Dante’s Creature Features
programme.desc: TFH creator Joe Dante pays tribute to the classic creature features that inspired a generation of filmmakers.

programme.title: Stephen King Stories and Decoding David Lynch
programme.desc: From Carrie to Eraserhead and beyond, Stephen King and David Lynch have defined cinematic storytelling for decades.

programme.title: Vincent Price: Master of the Silver Scream
programme.desc: From 'Haunted Hill' to Corman classics, Vincent Price sent shivers down the spines of horror fans for decades.

programme.title: Karloff: The King of Horror
programme.desc: Boris Karloff's portrayal of monsters and villains made him the undisputed king of 20th century horror.

programme.title: Bela Lugosi Beyond Dracula
programme.desc: From monster mashups and horror hijinks, Bela Lugosi was much more than cinema’s greatest vampire.

programme.title: Monsters & Misfits: The Legacy of Lon Chaney Jr.
programme.desc: Celebrate Lon Chaney Jr.’s big screen legacy of classic creatures and complex misfits.

programme.title: Christopher Lee: From Fangs to Frights
programme.desc: From Hammer hits to Corman classics and more, these movies made Christopher Lee a horror icon.

programme.title: Trailers From Hell
programme.sub-title: Big Hair and Big Scares Vol. 1
programme.desc: Hop in the DeLorean and return to the 80s, when slashers ruled the box office.

programme.title: Trailers From Hell
programme.sub-title: Big Hair and Big Scares Vol. 2
programme.desc: The nightmare continues with 80s hits and cult classics with Cronenberg, Cujo, and more!

programme.title: Terror Titans: The Films of Wes Craven and John Carpenter
programme.desc: Two masters of horror bring your nightmares to the big screen in this spine-chilling collection.

programme.title: Trailers From Hell
programme.desc: It was a “Night Of The Living Dead” that “I Walked With A Zombie” to finally meet “Rosemary’s Baby.”

programme.title: Trailers From Hell
programme.desc: It was an eerie night of "Dark Shadows” when I caught the “Brain Dead,” "Cemetery Man” looking just like a “Zombie.” He was caught “Burying The Ex” for her life insurance policy.

programme.title: Trailers From Hell
programme.sub-title: Demons, Devils, Chainsaws and Zombies Vol. 1
programme.desc: In a “Deep Red” part of the country, “The Texas Chainsaw Massacre” made all of us squirm like “Three On A Meathook.”

programme.title: Trailers From Hell
programme.sub-title: Demons, Devils, Chainsaws and Zombies Vol. 2
programme.desc: The nightmare never ends as your favorite filmmakers talk iconic horror movies.

programme.title: Dementia 13
programme.desc: Shocked by the death of her spouse, a scheming widow hatches a bold plan to get her hands on the inheritance, unaware that she is targeted by an axe-wielding murderer who lurks in the family's estate. What mystery shrouds the noble house?

programme.title: Monsters, Monsters Everywhere!
programme.desc: Mutated beasts, creepy crawlies, and more movie monsters are coming to get you!

programme.title: Remembering Romero
programme.desc: Looking back at the iconic films of horror director George A. Romero.

programme.title: Bikers, Babes, and Badass Cinema
programme.desc: Bikers, Babes, and Badass ACTION: Revisiting the best of 60s and 70s cult cinema.
